intro: Corallocarpus subhastatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved corallocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds.
